entry.title: LeetCode 04. 二维数组中的查找
entry.content:
04. 二维数组中的查找

在一个 n * m 的二维数组中，每一行都按照从左到右递增的顺序排序，每一列都按照从上到下递增的顺序排序。请完成一个函数，输入这样的一个二维数组和一个整数，判断数组中是否含有该整数。

Example 1:

给定 target = 5，返回 true。

给定 target = 20，返回 false。

Solution One:

  • Brute Force
  • Time complexity: $O(n^2)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

Solution Two

  • Linear Search
  • Time complexity: $O(n+m)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

Solution Three:

  • Binary Search

style_1

style_2

  • Time complexity: $O(n+m)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

entry.title: LeetCode 03. 数组中重复的数字
entry.content:
03. 数组中重复的数字

找出数组中重复的数字。

在一个长度为 n 的数组 nums 里的所有数字都在 0～n-1 的范围内。数组中某些数字是重复的，但不知道有几个数字重复了，也不知道每个数字重复了几次。请找出数组中任意一个重复的数字。

Example 1:

限制：

Solution One:

  • 空间优先

先排序，然后查找邻元素是否有相同的，存在重复，返回结果。

  • Time complexity: $O(nlogn)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

Solution Two

  • 时间优先

遍历整个数组，数字没有出现过将其加入哈希表；如果在哈希表中则直接返回。

dict()实现

set()实现

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(n)$

Solution Three:

  • 时间，空间均最优

数组中某些数字是重复的，但不知道有几个数字重复了，也不知道每个数字重复了几次。

这意味着，len(set(nums))<len(nums)（伪代码） ——> 使得位置 $i$ 处放元素 $i$ ，若处理后元素不在对应位置，说明重复并返回。

可以视作 原地哈希

style_1

style_2

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

Note

set()和dict()类似，也是一组key的集合，但不存储value。

entry.title: LeetCode 134. Gas Station
entry.content:
134. Gas Station

There are N gas stations along a circular route, where the amount of gas at station i is gas[i].

You have a car with an unlimited gas tank and it costs cost[i] of gas to travel from station i to its next station (i+1). You begin the journey with an empty tank at one of the gas stations.

Return the starting gas station’s index if you can travel around the circuit once in the clockwise direction, otherwise return -1.

Note:

  • If there exists a solution, it is guaranteed to be unique.
  • Both input arrays are non-empty and have the same length.
  • Each element in the input arrays is a non-negative integer.

Example 1:

Example 2:

Different coding styles

entry.title: LeetCode 455. Assign Cookies
entry.content:
455. Assign Cookies

Assume you are an awesome parent and want to give your children some cookies. But, you should give each child at most one cookie. Each child $i$ has a greed factor $g_i$, which is the minimum size of a cookie that the child will be content with; and each cookie $j$ has a size $s_j$. If $s_j$ >= $g_i$, we can assign the cookie $j$ to the child $i$, and the child $i$ will be content. Your goal is to maximize the number of your content children and output the maximum number.

$Note$:
You may assume the greed factor is always positive.
You cannot assign more than one cookie to one child.

Example 1:

Example 2:

Solution One:

Two pointer style

  • Time complexity: $O(nlog(n))$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

entry.title: LeetCode 392. Is Subsequence
entry.content:
392. Is Subsequence

Given a string s and a string t, check if s is subsequence of t.

You may assume that there is only lower case English letters in both s and t. t is potentially a very long (length ~= 500,000) string, and s is a short string (<=100).

A subsequence of a string is a new string which is formed from the original string by deleting some (can be none) of the characters without disturbing the relative positions of the remaining characters. (ie, "ace" is a subsequence of "abcde" while "aec" is not).

Example 1:

s = "abc", t = "ahbgdc"

Example 2:

s = "axc", t = "ahbgdc"
Return false.

Follow up:
If there are lots of incoming S, say S1, S2, … , Sk where k >= 1B, and you want to check one by one to see if T has its subsequence. In this scenario, how would you change your code?

Solution One:

Two pointer style

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

Solution Two:

Using built-in function

find()

find()函数：这种方法利用find的beg(开始)属性，动态规划起始位置

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

iter()

迭代器每次判断c in t，都会从判断之后的位置开始，因为内部会调用next()方法，性能比find方法低，不过比双指针性能高

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

Solution Three

Binary Search

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

entry.title: LeetCode 122. Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II
entry.content:
122. Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II

Say you have an array for which the $i^{th}$ element is the price of a given stock on day $i$.

Design an algorithm to find the maximum profit. You may complete as many transactions as you like (i.e., buy one and sell one share of the stock multiple times).

Note: You may not engage in multiple transactions at the same time (i.e., you must sell the stock before you buy again).

Example 1:

Example 2:

Solution One:

Greedy algorithm.

From the greedy perspective, the maximum profit is made up by each small profits. So, in this case, it is the accumulation of subtracting the adjacent two days when the result is positive.

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

Solution Two:

Dynamic programming My previous essay Also labuladong’s answer

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

entry.title: LeetCode 99. Recover Binary Search Tree
entry.content:
99. Recover Binary Search Tree

Two elements of a binary search tree (BST) are swapped by mistake.

Recover the tree without changing its structure.

Example 1:

Example 2:

Note:

This essay is based on leetcode official instruction and would be revised as well as edited again.

Solution One:

Sorting the array and exchange the two values.

  1. 按中序遍历树。遍历后的数组应该是几乎排序的列表，其中只有两个元素被交换。
  2. 在线性时间内确定几乎排序数组中的两个交换元素 x 和 y。
  3. 再次遍历树，将值 x 的节点改为 y，将值 y 的节点改为 x。
  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(n)$

Solution Two:

在方法一中，我们讨论了这个难题的三个简单子问题：

  1. 构造中序遍历序列。
  2. 在几乎排序的数组中查找两个交换的元素。
  3. 在数中交换两个节点的值。

现在我们再讨论三种方法，基本上都有：

  • 合并步骤一和步骤二，即在中序遍历确定交换的节点。
  • 交换节点值。

迭代和递归只进行少于一次的遍历，它们都需要高达 $O(H)$ 的空间来保存堆栈，其中 H 指的是树的高度

Recursion

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(H)$

Iteration

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(H)$

Solution Three

When Space complexity: $O(1)$ is required, the Moris method is the very one.

Morris 的遍历思想很简单：只遍历树而不是用空间。

在每个节点上，你必须决定下一个遍历的方向：遍历左子树或者右子树。如果不适用额外的空间，怎么指的左子树已经遍历完成了呢？

Morris 算法的思想是在节点和它的直接前驱之间设置一个临时的链接：predecessor.right = root，从该节点开始，找到它的直接前驱并验证是否存在链接。

  • 如果没有链接，设置连接并走向左子树。
  • 如果有连接，断开连接并走向右子树。

这里有一个小问题要处理：如果该节点没有左孩子，即没有左子树，则直接走向右子树。

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

entry.title: LeetCode 95. Unique Binary Search Trees II
entry.content:
95. Unique Binary Search Trees II

Given an integer n, generate all structurally unique BST‘s (binary search trees) that store values 1 … n.

Example:

Solution One:

可以看做递归和DP的结合

问组合有多少种，大概率都是卡特兰数

1.利用卡特兰数求解，G(n) = ∑i∈[0,n] G(i)G(n-i-1)
2.主要通过切点i,判断i的左右是否存在构成新的节点条件的值。
2.1 对于左边：是否存在x满足start<=x<i的值，如果存在则递归继续切分，继续判断，知道不满足返回[None]。
2.2 对于右边：是否存在x满足i<x<=end的值，如果存在则递归继续切分，继续判断，直到不满足返回[None]]。
3.通过for循环其实有着计算是个笛卡尔积的作用，leftright种可能。在循环中依次生成新的节点可能性，添加到all_trees列表中，
最后输出的列表将会包含所有中可能。因为该动态规划，采用自顶而下的方式。

注：这里用列表存储，因为继续切分得到的结果可能有多个，为了将这些结果合并，需采用for循环。

Solution Two:

Traditional DP style code

entry.title: LeetCode 94. Binary Tree Inorder Traversal
entry.content:
94. Binary Tree Inorder Traversal

Given a binary tree, return the inorder traversal of its nodes’ values.

Example:

Follow up: Recursive solution is trivial, could you do it iteratively?

Solution One:

Using Recursive strategy to ————

realize Inorder Traversal

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(n)$

More engineering form

Solution Two:

Iterative strategy

stack style

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(n)$

Solution Three:

The Morris traversal (Also a new data structure, threaded binarytree, is used)

Step 1: 将当前节点current初始化为根节点

Step 2: While current不为空，

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(n)$

Solution Four:

The color-marked method : an universal solution for all kind of traversal!

其核心思想如下：

  • 使用颜色标记节点的状态，新节点为白色，已访问的节点为灰色。
  • 如果遇到的节点为白色，则将其标记为灰色，然后将其右子节点、自身、左子节点依次入栈。
  • 如果遇到的节点为灰色，则将节点的值输出。

如要实现前序、后序遍历，只需要调整左右子节点的入栈顺序即可。

Simplified: setting white as TreeNode and gray as int to avoid introducing extra indicators

Even further ———— in Queue style for Hierarchical traversal

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(n)$

104. Maximum Depth of Binary Tree

Given a binary tree, find its maximum depth.

The maximum depth is the number of nodes along the longest path from the root node down to the farthest leaf node.

Note: A leaf is a node with no children.

Example:

Given binary tree [3,9,20,null,null,15,7],

return its depth = 3.

Note

python的list实际上是列表，只是可以作为栈来使用。所以新元素进来的时候是放后面的，pop(0)是从头部取元素,pop()是从尾部取元素 ————> 以此来区别实现队列和栈的功能。

Using Recursive strategy to ————

realize DFS

entry.title: LeetCode 20. Valid Parentheses
entry.content:
20. Valid Parentheses

Given a string containing just the characters (, ), {, }, [ and ], determine if the input string is valid.

An input string is valid if:

  1. Open brackets must be closed by the same type of brackets.
  2. Open brackets must be closed in the correct order.
    Note that an empty string is also considered valid.

Example 1:

Example 2:

Solution One:

Non-algorithmic solution:

using build-in function(while...in... & replace()) to locate and change the legal parentheses.

Note:

The time complexity is $O(n)$, however, the efficiency is unsatisfying due to the compelling and execution parts.

  • Time complexity: $O(n^2)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

Solution Two:

Direct implementation with stack

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

Solution Three:

Using hashmap and assistant-stack

Original

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

Modified

Using hashmap and assistant-stack

  • If c is the left parenthesis, pushed into the stack;
  • Otherwise, if the top stack-element does not correspond to the current parenthesis c, return false in advance(which improve algorithm efficiency).

Note:

When the stack is empty, stack.pop() will report an error; therefore, assigning an initial value to the stack ?, and establish key: ′? ′, Value: ′ in the hash table.

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

Solution Four:

Another idea using stack comparison(reversal compare)

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

entry.title: LeetCode 14. Longest Common Prefix
entry.content:
13. Roman to Integer

Write a function to find the longest common prefix string amongst an array of strings.

If there is no common prefix, return an empty string "".

Example 1:

Example 2:

Note:

All given inputs are in lowercase letters a-z.

Solution One:

Using zip() and set()

  • zip():Returns an iterator of tuples, where the i-th tuple contains the i-th element from each of the argument sequences or iterables.
  • set():Removing duplicates from the sequence(tuple).

When the len(set) == 1, which means elements are the same, add to the result.

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(n)$

Solution Two:

Base on the idea of $LCP(S1…Sn)=LCP(LCP(LCP(S1,S2),S3),…Sn)$

Note:

  • Using the ‘from behind to front’ will reduce comparison for every first element and save the time. Otherwise, solution one has better performance.
  • list[:-1] is easy to remove the last element which is not the same.
  • str.find():Return the lowest index in the string where substring sub is found within the slice s[start:end].
  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

Solution Three

To simulate the horizontal scan

  • Time complexity: $O(n^2)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

Appendix

Using divide and conquer or Binary search can also solve the task.

entry.title: LeetCode 13. Roman to Integer
entry.content:
13. Roman to Integer

Roman numerals are represented by seven different symbols: I, V, X, L, C, D and M.

For example, two is written as II in Roman numeral, just two one’s added together. Twelve is written as, XII, which is simply X + II. The number twenty seven is written as XXVII, which is XX + V + II.

Roman numerals are usually written largest to smallest from left to right. However, the numeral for four is not IIII. Instead, the number four is written as IV. Because the one is before the five we subtract it making four. The same principle applies to the number nine, which is written as IX. There are six instances where subtraction is used:

  • I can be placed before V (5) and X (10) to make 4 and 9.
  • X can be placed before L (50) and C (100) to make 40 and 90.
  • C can be placed before D (500) and M (1000) to make 400 and 900.

Given a roman numeral, convert it to an integer. Input is guaranteed to be within the range from 1 to 3999.

Example:

Solution One:

Using the key-value of dict() to realize the hashmap:

Note:

  • If the left symbol’s value smaller than right one, means subtraction.

  • Else, add the value to the result.

Original

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

Modified

Using enumerate() to simplified the code.

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(1)$

sorted：sorted 可以对所有可迭代的对象进行排序操作；sorted 方法返回的是一个新的 list，而不是在原来的基础上进行的操作。

Btw, it is the fastest one.

Using recursive method

entry.title: LeetCode 2. Add Two Numbers
entry.content:
2. Add Two Numbers

You are given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers. The digits are stored in reverse order and each of their nodes contain a single digit. Add the two numbers and return it as a linked list.

You may assume the two numbers do not contain any leading zero, except the number 0 itself.

Example:

Solution One:

Direct implementation, the flag is used to depict the carry for the highest position.

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(n)$

Modified

Faster than original one.

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity: $O(n)$

entry.title: LeetCode 141. Linked List Cycle
entry.content:
141. Linked List Cycle

Given a linked list, determine if it has a cycle in it.

To represent a cycle in the given linked list, we use an integer pos which represents the position (0-indexed) in the linked list where tail connects to. If pos is -1, then there is no cycle in the linked list.

Example2:

Example3:

entry.title: LeetCode 123. Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock III
entry.content:
123. Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock III

Say you have an array for which the $i^{th}$ element is the price of a given stock on day $i$.

Design an algorithm to find the maximum profit. You may complete at most two transactions.

Note: You may not engage in multiple transactions at the same time (i.e., you must sell the stock before you buy again).

Example 1:

Example 2:

Example 3:

Quotations:

Labuladong’s review elaborates the core of related DP-tasks in detailed.

The main idea is using “state” to enumerate all possibilities.

In short, the state will be replaced by the DP-unit(i.e. $dp[i] = max(0, dp[i−1])$) and initial states should be added. Then, following the Top-Down rule, the algorithm enumerates all possibilities to find a result.

Solution One:

There are only three actions in this task:

  • Buy
  • Sell
  • Stay: Hold/Pass

And in this task, there are four ‘moments’ need to be analyzed:

  • first_buy
  • first_sell
  • second_buy(if necessary)
  • second_sell(if necessary)

Based on the idea of dynamic programming and trying to exhaust all possible situations, here are the codes：

Original

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity:$O(n)$

entry.title: LeetCode 16. 3Sum Closest
entry.content:
16. 3Sum Closest

Given an array nums of n integers and an integer target, find three integers in nums such that the sum is closest to target. Return the sum of the three integers. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution.

Example:

Preliminary Analysis:

This task is quite similar to the LeetCode 15. 3Sum, and could be applied with the same method.

Solution One:

Original

  • Time complexity: $O(n^2)$
  • Space complexity:$O(1)$

Solution Two

Solution one is not quite efficient, so……

Adding some marginal condition judgments to optimize the algorithm.

In specific, every time before doing the While-loop, using the marginal(nearby) result to test the target. Hence, it would reduce the calculation amount.

Original

  • Time complexity: $O(n^2)$
  • Space complexity:$O(1)$

entry.title: LeetCode 15. 3Sum
entry.content:
15. 3Sum

Given an array nums of n integers, are there elements a, b, c in nums such that a + b + c = 0? Find all unique triplets in the array which gives the sum of zero.

Note:

The solution set must not contain duplicate triplets.

Example 1:

Preliminary Analysis:

It’s quit obvious that the array(nums) should be sorted before further action.

When the orderly sequence(witch is a ascending queue) is obtained, we can find the structures of the result are limited:

  1. neg. + neg. + pos.
  2. neg. + 0 + pos.
  3. neg. + pos. + pos.
  4. 0 + 0 + 0

Solution One:

It can be found that with 0 as the boundary, the condition is not satisfied when the largest number is> = 0 or the smallest number is <= 0, and it is not true at the same time;
Meanwhile, by using a =-(b + c), the task can be transformed from a three-variable problem to a (relative) anchor + bivariate problem.

It is another “dual pointer” method solvable task and required some modification.

Original

  • 当 nums[k] > 0 ，break跳出判断
  • 当 k > 0且nums[k] == nums[k - 1]时，跳过此元素nums[k]（否则会有重复解）
  • 当i < j时循环计算s = nums[k] + nums[i] + nums[j]，并按照以下规则执行双指针移动：
    1. 当s < 0时，i += 1并跳过所有重复的nums[i]；
    2. 当s > 0时，j -= 1并跳过所有重复的nums[j]；
    3. 当s == 0时，记录组合[k, i, j]至res，执行i += 1和j -= 1并跳过所有重复的nums[i]和nums[j]，防止记录重复。
  • Time complexity: $O(n^2)$
  • Space complexity:$O(1)$

Solution Two

Solution one’s time consuming is not satisfied. To enhance the performance, several build-in function are introduced.

By using an array bisection build-in algorithm: bisect , can significant increasing speed.

Original

  • Time complexity: $O(n^2)$
  • Space complexity:$O(1)$

entry.title: LeetCode 27. Remove Element
entry.content:
27. Remove Element

Given an array nums and a value val, remove all instances of that value in-place and return the new length.

Do not allocate extra space for another array, you must do this by modifying the input array in-place with O(1) extra memory.

The order of elements can be changed. It doesn’t matter what you leave beyond the new length.

Example 1:

Example 2:

Clarification:

Confused why the returned value is an integer but your answer is an array?

Note that the input array is passed in by reference, which means modification to the input array will be known to the caller as well.

Internally you can think of this:

Solution One:

Original

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity:$O(1)$

Solution Two

i and L traverse at most n steps. In this method, the number of assignments is equal to the number of elements to be deleted. Therefore, it is more efficient if there are few elements to be removed.

Original

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity:$O(1)$

Modified

Using the range() to simplify the code:

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity:$O(1)$

entry.title: LeetCode 1. Tow Sum
entry.content:
1. Two Sum

Given an array of integers, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to a specific target.

You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.

Example:

Solution One:

Using the List build-in function index() to solve the task.

Syntex:list.index(x[, start[, end]])

Original

  • Time complexity: $O(n^2)$
  • Space complexity:$O(n)$

Modified

  • Time complexity: $O(n^2)$
  • Space complexity:$O(n)$

Solution Two：

By using dict() and enumerate() to realize the hash-method

Original

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity:$O(n)/O(n^2)$

Modified

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity:$O(n)/O(n^2)$

Solution Three

Merely using {} without enumerate() to realize the hash-method

  • Time complexity: $O(n)$
  • Space complexity:$O(n)/O(n^2)$
